text: Thus says Yahweh: “Go down \add to\add* the house of the king of Judah and you must speak this word there.
And you must say, ‘Hear the word of Yahweh, O king of Judah, who sits on the throne of David, you, and your servants, and your people who enter through these gates.

Thus says Yahweh, “Act \add with\add* justice and righteousness, and deliver \add the\add* one who has been seized from the hand of \add the\add* oppressor. And you must not oppress \add the\add* immigrant, \add the\add* orphan, and \add the\add* widow. And you must not shed innocent blood in this place.

And if you indeed obey this word, then kings who sit for David on his throne will enter through the gates of this house, riding in chariots\f + \fr 22:4 \ft Hebrew “chariot” \f* and on horses, he, and his servants, and his people.
But if you do not obey these words, I swear by myself,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 22:5 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh, “that this house will become a site of ruins.” ’ ”
For thus says Yahweh concerning the house of the king of Judah,
“You \add are like\add* Gilead to me,
\add like\add* the head of the Lebanon.
⸤Surely⸥\f + \fr 22:6 \ft Literally “If not” \f* I will make you a desert,\f + \fr 22:6 \ft Or “wilderness” \f*
\add like\add* cities \add that\add* are not inhabited.
And I will consecrate against you destroyers,
everyone with his weapons,
and they will cut down ⸤your choicest cedars⸥,\f + \fr 22:7 \ft Literally “the choicest thing of your cedars” \f*
and cast \add them\add*\f + \fr 22:7 \ft Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation \f* on the fire.
And many nations will pass by this city and they will say each one to his neighbor, ‘⸤Why⸥\f + \fr 22:8 \ft Literally “Over what” \f* has Yahweh done in this manner to this great city?’
Then they will answer, ‘Because they abandoned the covenant of Yahweh their God, and bowed down in worship to other gods, and served them.’ ”
You must not weep for \add the\add* dead person,
and you must not show sympathy for him.
Weep bitterly for the one who goes away,
for he will not return, or see the land of his birth again.
For thus says Yahweh concerning Shallum, the son of Josiah, the king of Judah, who reigned as king in place of Josiah his father, who went out from this place: “He will not return here again.
But in \add the\add* place where they have deported him, there he will die, and he will not see this land again.
Woe \add to the one who\add* builds his house without righteousness,
and his upper rooms without justice.
His fellow countryman, he works for nothing,
and he does not give to him his wages.\f + \fr 22:13 \ft Hebrew “wage” \f*
Who says ‘I will build for myself
a spacious house with large upper rooms,’
and he cuts windows for it,
and \add it is\add*\f + \fr 22:14 \ft Here the subject is supplied from context in the English translation \f* paneled with cedar,
and he paints \add it\add*\f + \fr 22:14 \ft Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation \f* with vermilion.
Do you reign as king because you \add are\add* competing in cedar?
Did not your father eat and drink,
and he did justice and righteousness,
then it was well with him?
He judged \add the\add* legal cause of \add the\add* needy and \add the\add* poor,
\add and\add* then it was well.
⸤Is that not what it means to know me⸥?\f + \fr 22:16 \ft Literally “Not that the knowledge me” \f*” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 22:16 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
“But there is nothing \add in\add* your eyes and your heart
⸤except⸥\f + \fr 22:17 \ft Literally “but if” \f* your unlawful gain,
and on shedding the blood of the innocent,
and on committing oppression and extortion.”
⸤Therefore⸥\f + \fr 22:18 \ft Literally “To thus” \f* thus says Yahweh concerning Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, the king of Judah:
“They will not lament for him,
‘Alas, my brother,’ or ‘Alas, sister.’
They will not lament for him,
‘Alas, lord,’ or ‘alas, his majesty.’
He will be buried \add with\add* the burial of a donkey.

\add He will be\add*\f + \fr 22:19 \ft Here the subject is supplied from context in the English translation \f* dragged away and thrown ⸤outside⸥\f + \fr 22:19 \ft Literally “from beyond” \f* the gates of Jerusalem.
Go up \add to\add* Lebanon and cry out,
and in Bashan lift up your voice,
and cry out from Abarim,
for all your lovers are shattered.
I spoke to you ⸤in the times you were secure⸥,\f + \fr 22:21 \ft Literally “in your security” \f*
\add and\add* you said, ‘I will not listen!’
This \add was\add* your way from your youth,
for you have not obeyed my voice.
All your shepherds will shepherd \add the\add* wind,
and your lovers will go into captivity.
Yes, then you will be ashamed and humiliated
because of all your wickedness.
Inhabitants\f + \fr 22:23 \ft Hebrew “Inhabitant” \f* of Lebanon,
nestled among the cedars,
how you will groan when labor pains come to you,
fear and pain as the \add woman who\add* gives birth.

“As I live,” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 22:24 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f* Yahweh, “surely if Coniah, the son of Jehoiakim, the king of Judah, were \add the\add* seal on my right hand, surely from there I would wrench you off.

And I would give you into the hand of those who seek your life, and into the hand of those from whom you \add are\add* frightened by their presence, and into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, and into the hand of the Chaldeans.
And I will throw you and your mother who gave birth to you to another country where you were not born, and there you will die.
As for the land to which they are ⸤longing⸥\f + \fr 22:27 \ft Literally “lifting their inner self” \f* to return, they will not return.
\add Is\add* this man Coniah a despised, shattered vessel?
Or a vessel \add in which\add* there is no delight?
Why are he and his offspring thrown far,
and cast away to the land that they do not know?”
\add O\add* land, land, land, hear the word of Yahweh.
Thus says Yahweh:
“Record this man \add as\add* childless,
a man \add who\add* will not succeed in his days,
for no man from his offspring will succeed \add him\add*,\f + \fr 22:30 \ft Here the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation \f*
sitting on the throne of David and ruling again in Judah.”
